intro: Stellaria calycantha var. simcoei, commonly known as the Sierra starwort, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a low-growing perennial herb with small, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive member of the Caryophyllaceae family.
